alert.note: Alert for Central Douglas County; Central and Eastern Lake County; Eastern Douglas County Foothills; Jackson County; Klamath Basin; Northern and Eastern Klamath County and Western Lake County; Siskiyou Mountains and Southern Oregon Cascades; South Central Oregon Cascades (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued May 15 at 11:13AM PDT by NWS Medford
info.description: .Copious moisture combined with slow moving thunderstorms may result in localized heavy rain with flash flooding in portions of southern Oregon this afternoon and evening. ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM 3 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 10 PM PDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...Eastern Douglas, northeast Jackson, northern Klamath, and northwest Lake counties. This includes the cities of Steamboat, Toketee Falls, Tiller, Diamond Lake, Trail, Butte Falls, Prospect, Union Creek, Crater Lake, Crescent, Chemult, Silver Lake, and Fort Rock. * WHEN...From 3 PM this afternoon to 10 PM PDT this evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Recently burned areas, including the Archie Creek and South Obenchain burn scars may have an enhanced risk for flash flooding. Area highways could be impacted by flash flooding as well as rock slides and landslides, especially near burn scars and creeks and streams. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Slow moving thunderstorms with heavy rainfall may produce flash flooding. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
